resources.string: Slider for adjusting the battery level
Tap & Hold for a moment to Unpair
Network Failed!\nCheck if your internet is working.
It is safe to turn off or minimize this channel
Although this service doesn\'t use much resources, it\'s necessary to keep the notifier service running. But it\'s safe to minimize or turn off this notification channel from notification settings".
Visit this link from the other device
Select a receiver service to generate a pairing code and then scan or paste the code here.\n\nIf pairing is successful, you\'ll receive a confirmation on the receiver device.
Pairing code is invalid.\nMake sure it\'s correctly scanned or copied.
Can\'t open Camera.\nCopy the code manually and "Paste instead".
You need to provide the camera permission from app settings.

Automation apps like this are subject to battery optimization rules imposed by both device makers and Android itself.\n\nAs a result, your system may interrupt the notifier service from running indefinitely, even though it only waits for battery events without performing any actions.

If your device is unused for a long period of time, the system may pause this service until the device is active again. You won\'t receive any notifications during that time if this permission is not given.

If you don\'t open an app regularly, the system may pause it until you open it again. Since this is an automation app that doesn\'t require user interaction, itâ€™s important to disable hibernation for this app.
Some OEMs keep a whitelist of known apps that can resume their services after a phone restart. This service won\'t be able to restart if it\'s not allowed explicitly.
Allowing these should be sufficient for a consistent service. If it\'s not, please visit the Tutorial tab for more comprehensive step-by-step instructions.
